question_stem: The function \(g(x)\) is defined as \(g(x) = 2x^3 - 7\).  The function \(h(x)\) is defined as \(h(x) = g(x) + k\), where \(k\) is a constant.  It is given that \(h(2) = 9\).

parts.solution_text:
First, we evaluate \(g(2)\):
\(g(2) = 2(2^3) - 7 = 2(8) - 7 = 16 - 7 = 9\).

Since \(h(x) = g(x) + k\), we have \(h(2) = g(2) + k\).
We are given that \(h(2) = 9\), so \(9 = g(2) + k\).
Substituting \(g(2) = 9\), we get \(9 = 9 + k\).
Therefore, \(k = 9 - 9 = 0\).
